Detailed Description

A JoinProvider joins two providers by the specified column id for the specified filter rule. All matching rows will be joined, what means, that at maximum a join will result in m*n rows, where m is the row count of the first, n the row count of the second provider.
All column ids of both providers will be reflected, plus the following column ids:
c_key_column_id NumberType The joined key row. Must be used for append and insert.
c_first_provider_row_id NumberType The child row of the first provider.
c_second_provider_row_id NumberType The child row of the second provider.
c_first_provider_id ProviderType The first child provider (may be 0).
c_second_provider_id ProviderType The second child provider (may be 0).

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum JoinProvider::AffectedProvider
 

Which provider should be affected by modifing operations.

Enumerator:
Both  both providers, this is default
FirstOnly  only the first
SecondOnly  only the second
None  Read only.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

JoinProvider::JoinProvider (   ) 
 

If the default constructor is used, the parameters have to be provided by using the method Init.

JoinProvider::JoinProvider (  INT  provider_id,
Provider *  first_provider,
Provider *  second_provider,
INT  first_key_colid,
INT  second_key_colid,
JoinRule *  join_rule
) 
 

On construction the following parameters have to be specified:

  • provider_id: The provider id for this JoinProvider.
  • first_provider: The first child provider which should be joined.
  • second_provider: The second child provider which should be joined.
  • first_join_colid: The column id of the first child provider which should be used as join key.
  • second_join_colid: The column id of the second child provider which should be used as join key.
  • join_rule: Rule to determine a single join.

JoinProvider::~JoinProvider (   )  [virtual]
